Assessment.QuestionText: Which of the following statements about the <font face="courier new">SplitContainer</font> control are true and which statements are false?

Options.Option: The <font face="courier new">SplitContainer</font> control is used to separate the form into horizontal or vertical panels.
The <font face="courier new">Panel1</font> property is used to retrieve the right or the bottom panel of a <font face="courier new">SplitContainer</font> control.
The <font face="courier new">FixedPanel</font> property is used to specify which panel of a <font face="courier new">SplitContainer</font> control is not resized while changing the size of the form.
The <font face="courier new">SplitterMoving</font> event is raised when the splitter is moved.
The <font face="courier new">Shown()</font> method is used to display the <font face="courier new">SplitContainer</font> control to the user.

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that's correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that’s incorrect. The correct selections are: (A)–(True), (B)–(False), (C)–(True), (D)–(False), and (E)-(False).
